WRD_PostCrecheDestruction.synopsis: Laezel reacts to the Creche destruction.
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction.how_to_trigger: Triggers after the Creche is destroyed. Tries to start automatically if Laezel is present or next time she's around an avatar.Triggers as CRD at camp if not played yet.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation.synopsis: Laezel discusses what happened with Voss.
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation.how_to_trigger: Available after the Voss Camp Confrontation night after Creche

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche.synopsis: Laezel wants to go back to the Creche if you haven't done it.
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche.how_to_trigger: Proceed to entrance of Shar Temple, or see the Moonrise execution scene and then leave Moonrise to trigger this conversation. If possible, Laezel will try to play it as soon as possible, but if it fails for some reason, players can bring it up in her dialog.

WRD_PostZaithisk.synopsis: Laezel reacts on the Zaithisk being a lie. Should point to the Inqusitor if the conflict with him hasn't started, or at the inquisitor's office if it has. If Vlaakith betrayal has already happened, should point that she needs time to reflect on this.
WRD_PostZaithisk.how_to_trigger: Available after the Zaithisk in the Creche.

WRD_GithEggRelated.synopsis: Dialog with Laezel regarding the Gith egg.- Conversation about just taking it from the hatchery- Conversation after players give the egg to Lady Esther- If players kept it in Act3:- - Conversation about how the egg is doing. Reactivity based on whether it's in Laezel's inventory. Later in epilogue, if it was in her inventory, it would be hatched and she would be mentioning it.- If players lose the egg or get it destroyed before reaching Act3:- - Laezel is not yet attached to it, so she mentions that it wouldn't have survived anyway- If players lose the egg or get it destroyed after reaching Act3:- - Conversation about Laezel being mad at you for not taking good enough care of it- If players gave it to Lady Esther, after seeing the hatched gith in Act3:- - Conversation about what happened to the kid and how he turned out, depending on Laezel's current views and outcomes of the situation (boy attacked you and you killed him OR convinced him that you're good or he's flawed in his beliefs and he didn't attack you)Follow up in Epilogue:- If Laezel kept the egg, it hatches and she can talk more about it- If players kept the egg or left it in camp, it hatches and we get a Gazette update about it- If players destroyed or misplaced the egg, it's not mentioned in the epilogue
WRD_GithEggRelated.how_to_trigger: Multiple ways organically. The different branches trigger at different times. Usually by asking a question in the question bank, but obtaining the egg, giving the egg to Lady Esther and dealing with the hatched Gith kid in Act3 will also prompt an exclamation mark for a time.

WRD_VossWentToSewers.synopsis: Laezel wants to chat about Voss either on Orpheus Path or Vlaakith path
WRD_VossWentToSewers.how_to_trigger: Speak to Voss in SharessCaress without the hammer and have him go wait for you in the sewers. Plays after that

WRD_AmbushedByVlaakithsGith.synopsis: Laezel reacts to the players being ambushed by Vlaakith's men.Only happens after playesr have done the creche.
WRD_AmbushedByVlaakithsGith.how_to_trigger: Triggers after the Gith Ambush in SCL.

WRD_GotSilverSword.synopsis: After you recruit the gith, you can click on it to get the following set of questions. The gith will always be semi-hostile at this point. She comes from a hostile land and has been infected by her mortal enemy; she is not here to make friends.
WRD_GotSilverSword.how_to_trigger: Get the silver sword from Voss in Act3 either by completing the quest by showing him the Orphic Hammer, or by killing him and looting the sword

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo.synopsis: Laezel wants to talk about Orpheus

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit.synopsis: Laezel reaction from seeing Vlaakith in camp and accepting or refusing her mission
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit.how_to_trigger: After Laezel Camp night: Act3 -> VlaakithVisit

WRD_SavedFromOrin.synopsis: Conversation after being freed from Orin's abdcution. If players woke up the companion earlier they could have had anotehr short conversation before this in:LOW_BhaalTemple_PostBattleAbductee
WRD_SavedFromOrin.how_to_trigger: Becomes available when Laezel is saved from Orin's abduction.

WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer.synopsis: Laezel wants to talk about the Orphic hammer and how the players must get it in order to free/kill Orpheus.
WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer.how_to_trigger: Becomes available once players learn about the hammer by means other than Orpheus or Voss. Stops being available after long rest or after obtaining the hammer.If it becomes unavailable due to long rest, it will be an available question until you get the hammer.

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_17.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_17.text: Tsk'va. Gith m' zath'ak! I can still feel the temple ground shaking.

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_18.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_18.context:
NodeContext: tsk-VA! Gith mm zah-THOCK!

(Shit - an abomination to Gith!) Incensed about destruction of creche.

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_44.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_44.text: Girtar'rac neh toruun - 'One theft consumes all'. Protocol four-hundred-two.
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_44.context:
NodeContext: gur-teh-ROCK neh tore-ROON

Somewhat incensed over a bad decision

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_7.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_7.text: Our greed reduced Crèche Y'llek to rubble. We didn't just steal a mace. We stole the lives of my people!

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_5.speaker: Player
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_5.text: The crèche has turned against us. Why should I care about them?

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_2.speaker: Player
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_2.text: We should have been more careful.

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_38.speaker: Player
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_38.text: I'm so sorry, Lae'zel. All that death and destruction. There's no excuse.

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_10.speaker: Player
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_10.text: Who cares about them? We got a great weapon out of the deal.

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_29.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_29.text: And so should you, my kin.
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_29.context: NodeContext: A bit of sly sarcasm in 'my kin'. She is not seeing the player as a true githyanki in that moment.

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_15.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_15.text: Just because the zaith'isk failed, because Vlaakith has marked us, makes this no less of a tragedy.

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_22.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_22.text: I do not expect you to mourn. But I will not tolerate your rejoicing, either.

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_20.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_20.text: Shka'keth. Next time, think twice before getting grabby with powerful relics in mysterious places.

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_19.context: InternalNodeContext: Should not go back to Inparty questions if started as CRD/WRD so it's depracated

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_34.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_34.text: Just because Vlaakith has marked us makes this no less of a tragedy. The zaith'isk might yet have cured us.

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_26.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_26.text: The Inquisitor might have still have helped us. He might have yet led us to our cleansing.

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_42.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_42.text: Our own chance to purification is buried in that rubble!

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_13.speaker: Player
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_13.text: I broke protocol, and our people have perished. I am ashamed of it.

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_46.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_46.text: Our greed reduced Crèche Y'llek to rubble. Vlaakith, absolve my sin or skewer my heart. In each, you might make me worthy!
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_46.context: NodeContext: Somewhat incensed over a bad decision

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_28.speaker: Narrator
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_28.text: *Lae'zel's mind collides with yours. The crèche's decimation commands her every thought.*

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_39.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_39.context:
NodeContext: tsk-VA! Gith mm zah-THOCK!

(Shit - an abomination to Gith!) Incensed about destruction of creche.

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_12.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_12.text: Girtar'rac neh toruun - 'One theft consumes all'. Protocol four-hundred-two.

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_27.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_27.text: Your greed reduced Crèche Y'llek to rubble. You didn't just steal a mace. You stole the lives of my people!

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_14.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_14.text: Our greed reduced Crèche Y'llek to rubble. Vlaakith, absolve my sin or skewer my heart. In each, you might make me worthy!
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_14.context: NodeContext: Somewhat incensed over a bad decision

WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_32.speaker: Narrator
WRD_PostCrecheDestruction_32.text: *Lae'zel's mind collides with yours. The crèche's decimation commands her every thought.*

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_8.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_8.context:
NodeContext: CHK-ill VOSS VLAH-kith mm zah-THOCK!

Just killed Voss, who she believes is a traitor to her people and her queen. Somewhat vehement, but not too much so. His death is a tragedy in its own right.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_90.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_90.text: The traitor is dead. Zai, zai, zai!
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_90.context:
NodeContext: ZYE (like eye or rye)

Just killed Voss, who she believes is a traitor to her people and her queen. Somewhat vehement, but not too much so. His death is a tragedy in its own right.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_69.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_69.text: Voss was a heretic. You can no more extinguish the Undying Queen than you can the constellations.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_55.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_55.text: Voss was a heretic. You can no more stand against Vlaakith's will than you can extinguish the sun.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_38.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_38.text: One traitor, yes. But there is another in Baldur's Gate, at this Sharess' Caress.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_39.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_39.text: Then I will gut them too, and present their head to Vlaakith.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_113.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_113.text: One traitor, yes. But there are more out there, surely.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_22.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_22.text: Then I will gut them all and present their heads to Vlaakith.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_3.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_3.text: My queen - by the dead of night and the red of blood, I have felled Voss, Jhe'stil Hshar'lak, the traitor supreme.
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_3.context:
NodeContext: Calling out to Vlaakith as if in prayer. Not too loudly or vehemently, just confidently.

zhe-STIL heh-SHAR-lock

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_91.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_91.text: I will go to Baldur's Gate and punish the one who holds the means of your fall.
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_91.context: NodeContext: Calling out to Vlaakith as if in prayer. Not too loudly or vehemently, just confidently.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_7.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_7.text: This is how I will regain your favour.
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_7.context: NodeContext: Calling out to Vlaakith as if in prayer. Not too loudly or vehemently, just confidently.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_35.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_35.text: I have honoured the ten-thousand protocols. I will ascend.
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_35.context: NodeContext: Calling out to Vlaakith as if in prayer. Not too loudly or vehemently, just confidently.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_112.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_112.text: Who do you think is the Prism's occupant, this 'seed of Vlaakith's demise'?

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_79.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_79.text: I can't say. What matters is that they are a threat to Queen Vlaakith.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_58.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_58.text: As is Voss' contact in the city. Together, they would be the end of an empire, and the rise of the ghaik.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_97.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_97.text: And like any threat, it must be eliminated. We must find a way.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_54.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_54.text: Will Vlaakith stop hunting us, now that Voss is dead?

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_84.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_84.text: The truth is bound to reach her ears. I don't yet know when or how.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_115.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_115.text: We must tell Vlaakith of Voss' betrayal.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_47.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_47.text: So we will. Though I don't yet know when or how.
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_47.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_75.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_75.text: Until then, her warriors will hunt us. If they can't see reason, they'll see the gleam of a blade as it severs their necks.
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_75.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_24.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_24.text: Protect yourself. For now, we've no other choice - when she hears the truth, Vlaakith will absolve us.
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_24.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_73.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_73.text: What if we're wrong? Could Vlaakith really consume her own people?

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_89.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_89.context: NodeContext: Slightly annoyed at the suggestion she could be wrong, but ONLY just slightly.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_31.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_31.text: Ascension is a young githyanki's greatest honour, not this... this craven conspiracy Voss tried to poison us with.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_111.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_111.text: From the day of our hatching, young gith have one purpose: to train hard enough to slay a ghaik and take its head.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_44.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_44.text: Then we speak the Rite of Ascension, and a red dragon comes to fly us to Vlaakith in Tu'narath, City of Death.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_36.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_36.text: We are honoured with an eternal home in the Astral, not devoured by our queen like meat at the feast table.
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_36.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief, and a bit taken back by the suggestion Vlaakith could consume her own people.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_43.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_43.text: If Vlaakith isn't a tyrant, why would Voss want her dead?

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_9.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_9.text: At first, I thought he might crave power and control.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_59.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_59.text: The reins to a thousand dragons and the helms of a thousand spelljammer vessels.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_74.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_74.text: But I fear he sought something even more insidious: to hand the Githyanki Empire to the ghaik.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_20.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_20.text: If the Prism's occupant could bring such a horror to pass, I will exterminate them with prejudice.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_5.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_5.text: Ascension is a young githyanki's greatest honour.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_26.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_26.text: Long ago, the ghaik enslaved my people. They dominated our minds and bred us for war, until great Mother Gith took a hammer to our bonds.
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_26.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief. (In another version of these same words, she is not confident)

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_99.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_99.text: From the day of our hatching, young gith have one purpose: to train hard enough to slay a ghaik and take its head.
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_99.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief. (In another version of these same words, she is not confident)

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_37.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_37.text: Then we speak the Rite of Ascension, and a red dragon comes to fly us to Vlaakith in Tu'narath, City of Death.
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_37.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief. (In another version of these same words, she is not confident)

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_18.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_18.text: We are honoured with an eternal home in the Astral, celebrated for our victory. We are ascended.
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_18.context: NodeContext: Thoughtful, not vehement, but confident. She is affirming her belief. (In another version of these same words, she is not confident)

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_92.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_92.text: Is Vlaakith really the tyrant Voss thinks she is?

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_40.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_40.text: A tyrant cracks her whip and eradicates the weak for her own advance.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_64.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_64.text: Queen Vlaakith does so to prevent ghaik insurgence.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_82.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_82.text: The githyanki are the bulwark preventing illithid advance across the sixteen planes. One crack, and the bulwark collapses.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_33.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_33.text: The Undying Queen is ruthless because she has to be. Thanks to her, we endure. All of us.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_42.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_42.text: Very well - we know our task. Find Voss' contact in Baldur's Gate. They hold the key to setting the Prism's dweller loose.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_77.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_77.text: That key could mean Vlaakith's end - and that of my people.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_13.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_13.text: Repeat the chant, but with particular vigour.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_72.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_72.text: Zai! Your cry is worthy - let it roil the Astral Sea!
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_72.context:
NodeContext: ZYE (like eye or rye)

Just killed Voss, who she believes is a traitor to her people and her queen. Somewhat vehement, but not too much so. His death is a tragedy in its own right.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_105.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_105.text: 'Vlaakith'ka sivim hrath krash'ht. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.'
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_105.context:
NodeContext: Thoughtful, remembering what she was taught.

VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_0.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_0.text: These were the first words I ever read on tir'su slate.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_1.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_1.text: But they are no mere aphorism. They are law, they are creed - the root from which the ten-thousand protocols stem.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_96.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_96.text: 'Forsake one protocol, and forsake Vlaakith. Forsake Vlaakith, and be the blood and meat which sates her dragons.'

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_98.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_98.text: If Voss speaks true - if ascension is a lie, if tadpole purification is a fairy tale, then I have not sinned against Vlaakith...

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_45.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_45.context: NodeContext: 'I have not sinned against Vlaakith - she has sinned against ME.'

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_4.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_4.text: Could Vlaakith have been lying about the prince from the stories, too?

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_46.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_46.text: Orpheus, the Prince of the Comet. Traitor to the empire, ghaik asset - and long dead. So it is inscribed in the protocols.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_80.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_80.text: If I must question one protocol, I must question them all. Including every history I've read of Gith's Son, the so-called traitor prince.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_68.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_68.text: Ascension is a young githyanki's greatest honour.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_93.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_93.text: Long ago, the ghaik enslaved my people. They dominated our minds and bred us for war, until great Mother Gith took a hammer to our bonds.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_100.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_100.text: From the day of our hatching, young gith have one purpose: to train hard enough to slay a ghaik and take its head.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_10.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_10.text: Then we speak the Rite of Ascension, and a red dragon comes to fly us to Vlaakith in Tu'narath, City of Death.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_56.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_56.text: We are honoured with an eternal home in the Astral, celebrated for our victory. We are ascended. Or so I believed.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_95.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_95.text: Voss called Vlaakith a tyrant. Does this mean you agree?

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_83.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_83.text: I'd never thought Vlaakith a tyrant, or me as a vassal. She was the source of my might, and I the envoy of her will.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_70.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_70.text: A warrior. A champion. A destroyer.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_109.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_109.text: But if Voss is right, and Vlaakith consumes the ascended to gain power...

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_28.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_28.text: Then I am no destroyer. I am mere livestock, bred to be harvested and devoured.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_50.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_50.text: Every githyanki is a slave with a singular purpose. Not to cull the ghaik, not to prevent their Grand Design -

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_61.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_61.text: - but to raise Vlaakith to true godhood.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_29.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_29.text: Who is the one in the Prism, do you think?

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_110.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_110.text: I don't know. I can't know. And that drives me mad.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_14.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_14.text: At first, I thought them an illithid deception, a trick of the tadpole.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_104.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_104.text: But the dream figure is real. It lives in the Prism.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_76.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_76.text: Voss believes they are the seed of Vlaakith's demise and the agent of githyanki freedom.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_88.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_88.text: And I believe he may be right.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_23.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_23.text: But Voss believes they are the seed of Vlaakith's demise and the agent of githyanki freedom.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_86.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_86.text: And if Voss is wrong? If his claims are wrong and Vlaakith's are real?

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_19.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_19.text: Then when the kith'raki come for me - and come, they will - I will submit to their blades.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_27.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_27.text: They would feed me to their dragons. And I would deserve no better.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_101.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_101.text: Obviously. It's about time you figured it out.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_62.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_62.text: Obvious, you say. But does the dragon of the sky ever look to the worm, and dream of crawling?

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_71.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_71.text: I was taught but one way, the superior way. Vlaakith's way.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_49.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_49.text: Until now, I never thought Vlaakith a tyrant or me as a vassal. She was the source of my might, and I the envoy of her will.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_78.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_78.text: A warrior. A champion. A destroyer.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_87.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_87.text: Yes. I'd like time to think.

WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_81.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVossCampConfrontation_81.text: We'll meet Kith'rak Voss at Sharess' Caress, in Baldur's Gate. Until then, be vigilant. Vlaakith's eyes are upon us.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_3.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_3.text: I sought to reach a githyanki crèche and be rid of these tadpoles. Now we stalk forgotten lands haunted by darkness.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_0.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_0.text: I'm going to find my people. If you have any sense, you will follow.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_8.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_8.text: Forward, and forget my business at the crèche. You were right to lead us to Moonrise.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_41.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_41.text: I sought to reach a crèche and be rid of these tadpoles. Now we stalk forgotten lands haunted by darkness.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_40.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_40.text: I'm going to my people. If you have any sense, you will follow.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_11.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_11.text: I'm going to my people - it is our only hope of purification.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_10.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_10.text: I'm returning to the crèche - I must inform Vlaakith of the traitorous ghustil.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_24.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_24.text: If you have any good sense, you will follow.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_20.speaker: Narrator
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_20.text: *You consider your options, knowing that should Lae'zel depart alone for the crèche, she could fall to the curse.*

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_30.speaker: Player
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_30.text: If I had good sense, I'd slit your throat for defying me. You're staying with me.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_39.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_39.text: You would threaten Lae'zel of K'liir?

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_17.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_17.text: You bared your teeth and sprayed your venom. A threat to be savoured.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_21.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_21.text: Very well. Let's see what this Moonrise illuminates.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_27.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_27.text: Tsk'va fanh. Or as you might say in the common tongue: bullshit.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_32.speaker: Player
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_32.text: Forget the crèche. We've reached the Absolute's stronghold. This is where our answers lie.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_37.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_37.text: You may be right. I may be wrong. I hate that it's so.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_22.speaker: Player
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_22.text: The crèche is a priority. Let's make our way there.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_38.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_38.text: To the crèche - and do try to keep up.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_7.speaker: Player
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_7.text: Leave if you have to. But I'm not coming after you.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_51.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_51.text: Then our alliance ends, and my bruises deepen. Zhak vo'n'ash duj.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_49.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_49.text: So mad was I, that I allied with strangers.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_5.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_5.text: A madness you've cured, thank the Undying Queen.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_36.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_36.text: The inquisitor must hear of the zaithisk's failure. I'm going to my people at once.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_47.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_47.text: I sought to reach a githyanki crèche and be rid of these tadpoles. Now we stalk forgotten lands haunted by darkness.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_50.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_50.text: You promised we'd make for the crèche. Yet we still linger in these odious lands.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_4.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_4.text: The tadpole in my skull still screams to be purified.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_12.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_12.text: Further still, we must report the inquisitor's crimes to my venerable queen.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_45.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_45.text: I'm making the journey to the crèche, with or without you.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_16.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_16.text: Damn this target on my back - the tadpole in my skull still screams to be purified.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_13.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_13.text: I must inform Vlaakith of the traitorous ghustil.

WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_31.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_ProgressInAct2WithoutCreche_31.text: I must inform the inquisitor of the traitorous ghustil.

WRD_PostZaithisk_3.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_3.text: I followed protocol. I kept to my faith. Yet the zaith'isk might have killed me.

WRD_PostZaithisk_0.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_0.text: Tsk'va! The zaith'isk - it might have killed you. I felt your torment.

WRD_PostZaithisk_5.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_5.text: Someone must have tampered with it. An aberrance I can't begin to comprehend.

WRD_PostZaithisk_6.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_6.text: The ghustil tampered with it. Traitor - and there may be more still! This must be why the Inquisitor's come.

WRD_PostZaithisk_38.speaker: Player
WRD_PostZaithisk_38.text: The zaith'isk is supposed to kill you. I saw it for myself.

WRD_PostZaithisk_23.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_23.text: A deception - proof of the doctor's manipulations. The queen does not mislead Gith's children.

WRD_PostZaithisk_36.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_36.text: This zaith'isk is a deviation. It was altered - there is no other explanation.

WRD_PostZaithisk_13.speaker: Player
WRD_PostZaithisk_13.text: A traitorous doctor? How can you be so sure?

WRD_PostZaithisk_18.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_18.text: Vlaakith's does not abandon githyanki. The zaith'isk was tampered with. There is no other explanation.

WRD_PostZaithisk_29.speaker: Player
WRD_PostZaithisk_29.text: Are traitors so common among the githyanki?

WRD_PostZaithisk_32.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_32.text: Vlaakith has taught us of Hshar'lak - traitors hunted, slaughtered, and erased from our histories.

WRD_PostZaithisk_39.speaker: Player
WRD_PostZaithisk_39.text: Who could have tampered with the device?

WRD_PostZaithisk_22.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_22.text: There must be Hshar'lak in this crèche - a traitor. The sort that is hunted, slaughtered, and erased from our histories.

WRD_PostZaithisk_1.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_1.text: Few would dare dishonour their queen. Fewer still would be so brazen.

WRD_PostZaithisk_15.speaker: Player
WRD_PostZaithisk_15.text: How about a 'thank you'? I just saved your life.

WRD_PostZaithisk_41.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_41.context: NodeContext: With a degree of sincereity

WRD_PostZaithisk_21.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_21.text: Now hurry. We must go to the ch'r'ai and inform him of the zaith'isk's tampering.

WRD_PostZaithisk_26.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_26.text: Now hurry. We must go to the ch'r'ai and inform him of the doctor's sedition.

WRD_PostZaithisk_24.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_24.text: The zaith'isk, the Inquisitor - such aberrations beggar belief. To the command centre. We might find a way to inform Vlaakith of their treason.

WRD_PostZaithisk_19.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_19.text: The doctor, the Inquisitor - such heresy beggars belief. To the command centre. We might find a way to inform Vlaakith of their treason.

WRD_PostZaithisk_11.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_11.text: Vlaakith must have some purpose, some design I'm not meant to see.

WRD_PostZaithisk_27.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_27.text: In my queen, I trust. One day soon she will honour me for it. She must.

WRD_PostZaithisk_37.speaker: Player
WRD_PostZaithisk_37.text: I was so close to a cure. If only I'd held on longer...

WRD_PostZaithisk_33.speaker: Player
WRD_PostZaithisk_33.text: You were so close to a cure, if only you'd held on longer...

WRD_PostZaithisk_2.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_2.text: There was nothing to be done. The ghustil corrupted the machine - it must be so.

WRD_PostZaithisk_16.speaker: Player
WRD_PostZaithisk_16.text: We must inform the Inquisitor. The crèche is in danger.

WRD_PostZaithisk_34.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_PostZaithisk_34.text: The ghustil' must have tampered with it. An aberrance I can't begin to comprehend. As is all of Crèche Y'llek.

WRD_GithEggRelated_5.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_5.text: Bah - that was a githyanki egg, not some arcane curiosity for pawning off on shady scholars!

WRD_GithEggRelated_74.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_74.text: Who knows what atrocities will be inflicted upon it?

WRD_GithEggRelated_19.speaker: Player
WRD_GithEggRelated_19.text: It's just an egg, Lae'zel. If it were going to hatch, it already would have.

WRD_GithEggRelated_46.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_46.text: Life still pulses inside it. The egg could nurture a great future kith'rak, a winner of wars, and you chucked it to the first bidder.

WRD_GithEggRelated_14.speaker: Player
WRD_GithEggRelated_14.text: Hush up. You're lucky I didn't make an omelette out of it.

WRD_GithEggRelated_18.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_18.text: Life still pulses inside that egg. It could nurture a great future kith'rak, a winner of wars, and you chucked it at the first bidder.

WRD_GithEggRelated_48.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_48.text: You can still take it back by force. You've spilled your share of blood. What's a little more, if it means proving you haven't fully lost your failing senses?

WRD_GithEggRelated_68.speaker: Player
WRD_GithEggRelated_68.text: You're right, Lae'zel. But what's done is done.

WRD_GithEggRelated_8.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_8.text: Better the egg were destroyed than to spawn such... such an anomaly.

WRD_GithEggRelated_36.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_36.text: His death was a blessed escape. He could never understand the weight of Vlaakith's chains... or the relief to come when Orpheus lifts them.

WRD_GithEggRelated_10.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_10.text: Mother Gith would have me look ahead, never behind. But I can only wonder -

WRD_GithEggRelated_9.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_9.text: How might that boy have served his people, if he'd only been given the chance?

WRD_GithEggRelated_38.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_38.text: He will never suffer under Vlaakith's yoke. But he will also never see the crash of the Comet, or live freely in the prince's glow.

WRD_GithEggRelated_58.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_58.text: He deserved to know Vlaakith's protocols, slaughtered ghaik, ascended and known his queen's undead glory.

WRD_GithEggRelated_73.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_73.context: NodeContext: Almost about to wonder what might have been if you'd kept the egg and let it hatch in your care.

WRD_GithEggRelated_69.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_69.text: Vlaakith would never ascend a deviant like this. He will never know her protocols, never ride a dragon to the City of Death.

WRD_GithEggRelated_25.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_25.context: NodeContext: Almost about to wonder what might have been if you'd kept the egg and let it hatch in your care.

WRD_GithEggRelated_62.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_62.text: No, I must look only ahead, never behind. I suggest you do the same.

WRD_GithEggRelated_16.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_16.text: The egg grows ever warmer, the hum of life within it louder. It may yet hatch - though not soon, by my estimation.

WRD_GithEggRelated_67.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_67.text: Give it to me. Perhaps it will fare better under my care.

WRD_GithEggRelated_1.speaker: Player
WRD_GithEggRelated_1.text: I don't suppose you'd consider parenting the child when it hatches.

WRD_GithEggRelated_17.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_17.text: Well. Most certainly not. Githyanki are raised by a varsh and trained by a sa'varsh. We are neither.

WRD_GithEggRelated_76.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_76.text: Should the egg hatch, we will find a suitable home for the whelp. I will hand it to the kith'raki when the time comes.

WRD_GithEggRelated_63.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_63.text: Perhaps Crèche K'liir would take them in. Sa'varsh Urlon is a stern taskmaster. The fledgling would be stronger and smarter by dint of his teachings.

WRD_GithEggRelated_3.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_3.text: After we free Orpheus we can visit the matter. If the egg hatches beforehand...

WRD_GithEggRelated_34.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_34.text: ... well. We will shield it from the lich queen's zealots. Whatever may come, I will not let Vlaakith poison the fledgling with lies.

WRD_GithEggRelated_77.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_77.text: Bah. Parentage - a notion so foreign I was sure it was fiction when I first read of it in the slates.

WRD_GithEggRelated_39.speaker: Player
WRD_GithEggRelated_39.text: You're getting attached! Should I start calling you 'Mommy Lae'zel'?

WRD_GithEggRelated_79.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_79.text: Only if you want me to roast you over a campfire using my blade as a spit.

WRD_GithEggRelated_71.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_71.text: Githyanki are raised by a varsh and trained by a sa'varsh. We are neither.

WRD_GithEggRelated_0.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_0.text: But it is true that I feel some manner of - responsibility - for this unhatched whelp.

WRD_GithEggRelated_44.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_44.text: After we free Orpheus we can revisit the matter. If the egg hatches beforehand...

WRD_GithEggRelated_33.speaker: Player
WRD_GithEggRelated_33.text: We should keep it in camp, away from danger.

WRD_GithEggRelated_70.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_70.text: The very notion puts me ill at ease. Our camp has been visited by all manner of devils and tainted by the Chosen of Bhaal.

WRD_GithEggRelated_64.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_64.text: The very notion puts me ill at ease. Our camp has been visited by a scheming devil and tainted by the Chosen of Bhaal.

WRD_GithEggRelated_7.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_7.text: It has afforded us as much disquiet as it has rest.

WRD_GithEggRelated_20.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_20.text: Leave the egg with me. There's no need for further discussion.

WRD_GithEggRelated_72.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_72.text: A camp once visited by a scheming devil is no safe haven for the unhatched. It has afforded us as much disquiet as it has rest.

WRD_GithEggRelated_57.speaker: Player
WRD_GithEggRelated_57.context: InternalNodeContext: Intentionally not checking if the player has it - this dialog will not play if it's not in their possession.

WRD_GithEggRelated_45.speaker: Player
WRD_GithEggRelated_45.text: The egg is a distraction. It can stay where it is.

WRD_GithEggRelated_13.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_13.text: The egg is not a distraction, it is a stimulation. It harbours not just a fledgling, but a testament of my mission.

WRD_GithEggRelated_43.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_43.text: An effigy of githyanki destiny, incubating before our very eyes.

WRD_GithEggRelated_47.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_47.text: I know it is a mere egg. It may never hatch. If it does, it might beget a failure.

WRD_GithEggRelated_32.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_32.text: But it might also beget a fighter. And I intend to give it the chance.

WRD_GithEggRelated_50.speaker: Player
WRD_GithEggRelated_50.text: No. The egg is better off where it is.

WRD_GithEggRelated_42.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_42.text: Chk. Then I will entrust the egg to you. Begrudgingly, if it weren't obvious.

WRD_GithEggRelated_49.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_49.text: If the egg survives in your care, I invite you to wallow in my wrongness with all the glee you can conjure.

WRD_GithEggRelated_51.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_51.text: In its heat lives stimulation, and in its throbbing, exhilaration. An effigy of githyanki future, incubated inside a fragile shell.

WRD_GithEggRelated_26.speaker: Player
WRD_GithEggRelated_26.text: I don't suppose you'd consider parenting the child when it hatches.

WRD_GithEggRelated_54.speaker: Player
WRD_GithEggRelated_54.text: You're getting attached! Should I start calling you 'Mommy Lae'zel'?

WRD_GithEggRelated_30.speaker: Player
WRD_GithEggRelated_30.text: We should keep it in camp, away from danger.

WRD_GithEggRelated_24.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_24.text: An unhatched githyanki egg should be the burden of a varsh, not a warrior, whether ascended or otherwise.

WRD_GithEggRelated_31.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_31.text: And yet - I'm drawn to the warmth of it. A child of Gith and a servant of Vlaakith grows within.
WRD_GithEggRelated_31.context: NodeContext: A momentary maternal instinct comes over Lae'zel

WRD_GithEggRelated_59.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_59.text: Keep it close. Perhaps in our care, it might yet hatch.

WRD_GithEggRelated_75.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_75.text: And don't you dare pass it to that lunatic woman prowling the mountain pass.

WRD_GithEggRelated_52.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_52.text: Perhaps I might be the one to teach it of Vlaakith's Protocols.

WRD_GithEggRelated_53.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_53.text: And yet - I'm drawn to the warmth of it. A child of Gith grows within.

WRD_GithEggRelated_37.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_37.text: The egg is gone? Chk - I was a fool to let you anywhere near it.

WRD_GithEggRelated_56.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_56.text: Though perhaps - perhaps it was inevitable.

WRD_GithEggRelated_40.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_40.text: A fragile thing - easily lost, easily broken. But inside it, I glimpsed a speck of my people's future.

WRD_GithEggRelated_15.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GithEggRelated_15.text: A future I will fight for, and one I would die for.

WRD_VossWentToSewers_6.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_VossWentToSewers_6.text: Voss has done his duty. Now we will do ours.

WRD_VossWentToSewers_38.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_VossWentToSewers_38.text: When we next enter the Astral Prism, we will break Orpheus free.

WRD_VossWentToSewers_28.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_VossWentToSewers_28.text: With the Prince of the Comet at our sides, we can end the Grand Design, and restore the throne to Gith's heir.

WRD_VossWentToSewers_24.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_VossWentToSewers_24.text: To the undercity. Voss deserves to know the Hammer is ours.

WRD_VossWentToSewers_21.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_VossWentToSewers_21.text: We will take the Orphic Hammer from the House of Hope. And when we next enter the Astral Prism, we will break Orpheus free.

WRD_VossWentToSewers_8.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_VossWentToSewers_8.text: We must find our way to the House of Hope and take the Orphic Hammer.

WRD_VossWentToSewers_12.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_VossWentToSewers_12.text: When we next enter the Astral Prism, we will use the hammer to break Orpheus free.

WRD_VossWentToSewers_31.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_VossWentToSewers_31.text: The traitor Voss lives. If you meant to frustrate me, congratulations on your pathetic victory.

WRD_VossWentToSewers_35.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_VossWentToSewers_35.text: Still, it's a minor consideration: We know our most crucial duty.

WRD_VossWentToSewers_15.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_VossWentToSewers_15.text: When we next enter the Astral Prism, we will break Orpheus free.

WRD_VossWentToSewers_10.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_VossWentToSewers_10.text: Still, it's a minor consideration: We know our most crucial duty.

WRD_VossWentToSewers_14.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_VossWentToSewers_14.text: We will take the Orphic Hammer from the House of Hope. And when we next enter the Astral Prism, we will break Orpheus free.

WRD_VossWentToSewers_11.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_VossWentToSewers_11.text: Still, it's a minor consideration: We know our most crucial duty.

WRD_VossWentToSewers_4.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_VossWentToSewers_4.text: We must find a way to the House of Hope and take the Orphic Hammer.

WRD_VossWentToSewers_16.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_VossWentToSewers_16.text: First, we fell the false prince. Next, the elder brain. And I will ascend to my queen in glory.

WRD_AmbushedByVlaakithsGith_1.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AmbushedByVlaakithsGith_1.text: It is as we knew. My people have turned their blades against us.

WRD_AmbushedByVlaakithsGith_2.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AmbushedByVlaakithsGith_2.text: They will emerge from the shadows and descend from the skies. And we will grant them their only just fate:

WRD_AmbushedByVlaakithsGith_0.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AmbushedByVlaakithsGith_0.text: Vlaakith tests my might and my nerve. I will prove to her that my weapon is keen and my muscles are strong.

WRD_AmbushedByVlaakithsGith_3.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AmbushedByVlaakithsGith_3.text: Each raider I fell will bring me closer to my queen.

WRD_AmbushedByVlaakithsGith_4.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AmbushedByVlaakithsGith_4.text: Tsk'va. My people turn their blades against us.

WRD_GotSilverSword_67.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_67.text: Since I was old enough to hold a blade, I've dreamt of wielding a silver sword.

WRD_GotSilverSword_75.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_75.text: The swords cleave both meat and mind, body and brain. To swing one, mesmerising; to be slain by one, agonising.
WRD_GotSilverSword_75.context: NodeContext: Thrilled about having retrieved a silver sword

WRD_GotSilverSword_74.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_74.text: All blood I'll spill with this sword will feed Queen Vlaakith's legacy.
WRD_GotSilverSword_74.context: NodeContext: Thrilled about having retrieved a silver sword

WRD_GotSilverSword_53.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_53.text: It is almost tainted by your vile act. This is a weapon that is earned by deeds of legendary proportions.

WRD_GotSilverSword_55.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_55.text: I resent how you came by it - but I cannot deny its power.

WRD_GotSilverSword_40.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_40.text: Every gith has the right to prove themselves worthy of their silver.

WRD_GotSilverSword_28.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_28.text: That right was snatched from me. The sword is an ill-gotten prize - yet one I mustn't refuse.

WRD_GotSilverSword_21.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_21.text: The power of the blade cannot be understated. In this time of my people's greatest need, we must wield it still.

WRD_GotSilverSword_76.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_76.text: Everyone I bleed with the sword will be my tribute to Prince Orpheus.
WRD_GotSilverSword_76.context: NodeContext: Thrilled about having retrieved a silver sword

WRD_GotSilverSword_37.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_37.text: A shame Voss won't be there to see the righteous carnage.

WRD_GotSilverSword_3.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_3.text: You should feel shamed by the lie you told to get it. But the silver is too pure to be tainted by simple deception.
WRD_GotSilverSword_3.context: NodeContext: Thrilled about having retrieved a silver sword

WRD_GotSilverSword_22.speaker: Player
WRD_GotSilverSword_22.text: Only githyanki may wield a silver sword. Or would you permit others?

WRD_GotSilverSword_46.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_46.text: 'Only Gith's children may wield swords of silver - unless a githyanki grants the right in exceptional circumstance.'

WRD_GotSilverSword_2.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_2.text: The illithid Grand Design nears; the True Heir is shackled. These are exceptional circumstances. I grant my allies the right to my silver.

WRD_GotSilverSword_29.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_29.text: The illithid Grand Design nears; the traitor prince must be slain. These are exceptional circumstances. I grant all my allies the right to my silver.

WRD_GotSilverSword_14.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_14.text: These tadpoles in our heads are sufficiently exceptional. I grant all my allies the right to my silver.

WRD_GotSilverSword_51.speaker: Player
WRD_GotSilverSword_51.text: Only gith are permitted to wield these swords, right?

WRD_GotSilverSword_13.speaker: Player
WRD_GotSilverSword_13.text: Think on your knowledge of githyanki silver swords. What details did Lae'zel miss?

WRD_GotSilverSword_63.speaker: Player
WRD_GotSilverSword_63.text: Think on your knowledge of silver swords. What details did Lae'zel miss?

WRD_GotSilverSword_79.speaker: Narrator
WRD_GotSilverSword_79.text: *You recall another fact about silver swords: the githyanki forbid their use by all other peoples.*

WRD_GotSilverSword_47.speaker: Narrator
WRD_GotSilverSword_47.text: *Lae'zel gave a thorough description. You can't think of more you would add.*

WRD_GotSilverSword_1.speaker: Player
WRD_GotSilverSword_1.text: The sword is a fine tool. But I'd prefer a lavish life in Tu'narath over knighthood.

WRD_GotSilverSword_5.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_5.text: I've learned of your kind. The decadent and the indolent of Tu'narath.

WRD_GotSilverSword_43.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_43.text: They gaze on our peoples' great works but can't grasp their beauty. They will never understand the ecstasy of our hymns or the fury of our citadels.

WRD_GotSilverSword_12.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_12.text: I want more for myself than to languish. I want to battle, I want to bleed.

WRD_GotSilverSword_7.speaker: Player
WRD_GotSilverSword_7.text: I shared your dream. A keen blade for an entire ghaik massacre.

WRD_GotSilverSword_44.speaker: Player
WRD_GotSilverSword_44.text: Could this sword be enough to break Orpheus free?

WRD_GotSilverSword_10.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_10.text: Certainly not, or the prince's honour guard would have already fractured his prison.

WRD_GotSilverSword_45.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_45.text: Only the Orphic Hammer can break Orpheus free.

WRD_GotSilverSword_34.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_34.text: To break Orpheus free, we will need the Orphic Hammer.

WRD_GotSilverSword_0.speaker: Player
WRD_GotSilverSword_0.text: What makes the silver sword so special?

WRD_GotSilverSword_6.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_6.text: A kith'rak's silver sword is more than a weapon. It is an extension of your will, an entire limb unto itself.

WRD_GotSilverSword_33.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_33.text: You merely need to think 'strike', and it strikes. The sword carves the correct path, and carries your arm with it.

WRD_GotSilverSword_38.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_38.text: The ancient slates tell us that each sword holds a fragment of the Living Gate - a flesh-portal made from the stuffs of nightmare.

WRD_GotSilverSword_66.speaker: Narrator
WRD_GotSilverSword_66.text: *The terrible Living Gate - thinner than a lamb's hair, and hidden deep beneath the Feywild.*

WRD_GotSilverSword_17.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_17.text: The silver injures the body. The gate's flesh injures the mind. A formidable weapon against ghaik.

WRD_GotSilverSword_19.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_19.text: Very well. Voss has done his duty. Now we will do ours.

WRD_GotSilverSword_39.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_39.text: Very well - we know our duty.

WRD_GotSilverSword_26.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_26.text: Very well - we know our duty.

WRD_GotSilverSword_36.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_36.text: The matter of the Traitor Voss, perhaps? If you meant to frustrate me, congratulations on your pathetic victory.

WRD_GotSilverSword_18.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_18.text: The matter of the Traitor Voss, perhaps? If you meant to frustrate me, congratulations on your pathetic victory.

WRD_GotSilverSword_65.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_65.text: The matter of the Traitor Voss, perhaps? If you meant to frustrate me, congratulations on your pathetic victory.

WRD_GotSilverSword_48.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_48.text: One last matter: the traitor Voss still lives. If you meant to frustrate me, congratulations on your pathetic victory.

WRD_GotSilverSword_73.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_73.text: One last matter: the traitor Voss still lives. If you meant to frustrate me, congratulations on your pathetic victory.

WRD_GotSilverSword_4.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_4.text: One last matter: the traitor Voss still lives. If you meant to frustrate me, congratulations on your pathetic victory.

WRD_GotSilverSword_35.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_35.text: This sword represents a githyanki's might. It is to be earned through trial and tribulation, not stolen.

WRD_GotSilverSword_62.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_62.text: A single lie robbed me of my own achievement.Tsk'va!

WRD_GotSilverSword_30.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_30.text: This sword represents a githyanki's might. It is to be earned through trial and tribulation, not taken without permit.

WRD_GotSilverSword_69.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_GotSilverSword_69.text: It is an ill-gotten prize - yet one I mustn't refuse.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_54.speaker: Narrator
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_54.text: *Your parasite communes with Lae'zel's. Her heart races as she learns of the events inside the Astral Prism.*

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_9.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_9.text: Orpheus - Gith's only son. He lives.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_57.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_57.text: Orpheus - Gith's only son. He lives.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_57.context: NodeContext: In a certain amount of awe.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_41.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_41.text: It is not the ghaik visitor that Vlaakith would destroy and Voss would set free -
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_41.context: NodeContext: In a certain amount of awe.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_71.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_71.text: - it is Orpheus. The Blood of the Mother, the Prince of the Comet.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_71.context: NodeContext: In a certain amount of awe.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_40.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_40.text: - it is Orpheus. The traitor prince, the lakzerai.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_40.context:
NodeContext: lahk-zeh-rye (he who spurned his people)

In a certain amount of awe.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_48.speaker: Player
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_48.text: Orpheus? The same one from the story?

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_68.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_68.text: Listen close - the Emperor spoke only in half-truths. For you to know the tale of Orpheus, you must know the tale of Gith, and of Vlaakith.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_38.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_38.text: Long ago, when we rose up against our ghaik slavers, Mother Gith made for the Hells to secure an alliance with the archdevil Tiamat.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_44.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_44.text: Tiamat gifted the githyanki our red dragons. Gith remained in the Hells and Tiamat's envoy proclaimed Vlaakith our ruler.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_65.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_65.text: The first Vlaakith of many. It is Vlaakith One-Five-Seven whom my people now call 'queen'.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_7.speaker: Player
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_7.text: One-hundred fifty-seven? That's a lot of Vlaakiths.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_78.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_78.text: Yes. Our current queen has claimed undeath and reigned for a thousand years.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_60.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_60.text: But it was the first whom Orpheus tried to slay.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_34.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_34.text: Orpheus was - is - Gith's only son. He led his mother's own honour guard in a coup against Vlaakith One.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_49.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_49.text: Orpheus was - is - Gith's renegade spawn. A ghaik thrall who would return us to our slavers.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_49.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_1.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_1.text: He convinced his own mother's honour guard to join a coup against Vlaakith One. He would have fed our empire to the illithids had he succeeded.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_1.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_74.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_74.text: It was Kith'rak Voss himself who slayed the prince in vicious battle. Or so the varshes teach us.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_46.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_46.text: Yet the Prince of the Comet's been with us, subdued by that repugnant illithid.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_46.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_58.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_58.text: Should Orpheus go free, he would tear Vlaakith's empire to pieces and build new glory from the scraps.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_58.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_17.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_17.text: Yet the traitor's with us, controlled by that repugnant illithid.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_17.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_27.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_27.text: Should Orpheus go free, he would hand Vlaakith's dominion to his ghaik masters.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_27.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_37.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_37.text: The Astral Plane would be first to fall. The others would soon follow.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_37.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_2.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_2.text: We meet Voss in the city. And we obtain the key to freeing Orpheus from his prison.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_2.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_0.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_0.text: We find the one Voss was meeting in the city. They hold the key to Orpheus' prison. It must be destroyed, and Voss' contact along with it.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_55.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_55.text: The prince is a ghaik puppet cloaked in githyanki skin, and the most powerful mind-master known to my people.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_79.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_79.text: We find a way to enter the Prism and slay Orpheus.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_47.speaker: Player
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_47.text: Then Voss was right. Orpheus is the seed of Vlaakith's demise.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_61.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_61.text: He is a ghaik puppet cloaked in githyanki skin, and the most powerful mind-master known to my people.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_61.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_70.speaker: Player
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_70.text: Orpheus wasn't killed, he was imprisoned. Can you trust your teachings?

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_26.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_26.text: 'Vlaakith'ka sivim hrath krash'ht. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.'

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_10.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_10.text: This is the creed. I will not abandon all ten-thousand protocols over one sovereign secret.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_86.speaker: Player
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_86.text: It's just one githyanki. Is he really all that dangerous to Vlaakith?

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_24.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_24.text: Orpheus is not just a githyanki. He is Mother Gith's blood.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_24.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_36.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_36.text: Every word Voss spoke, he spoke true. Orpheus is the living proof of the queen's lies, and the living weapon that conquered our ghaik slavers.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_36.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_63.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_63.text: One word from his lips, and the people would doubt. Two words, and they would rage. Three words, and they would bow to the True Heir.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_63.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_18.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_18.text: If the githyanki are to be free, the Prince of the Comet must lead the way.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_18.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some awe. She respects Orpheus.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_20.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_20.text: Orpheus is not githyanki. He is a ghaik puppet cloaked in githyanki skin, and the most powerful mind-master known to my people.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_20.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_21.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_21.text: One word from his scheming lips, and the people would doubt. Two words, and they would rage. Three words, and they would bow to the False Prince.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_21.context: NodeContext: Grounded, but with some worry. Orpheus in this path is a threat she wants to eliminate.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_43.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_43.text: The githyanki would be slaves once more - and one by one, the planes would fall to the ghaik.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_4.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_4.text: The Spirits of the Fallen, be my witness: I will find the means of reaching the prince through his domed prison.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_30.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_30.text: And when I return to the Astral Prism, I will slay him in the name of the undying Queen Vlaakith.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_72.speaker: Player
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_72.text: Praise be to the lich queen. May her reign be eternal.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_81.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_81.text: Vlaakith'ka sivim hrath krash'ht. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_53.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_53.text: Our current Vlaakith has claimed undeath and reigned for a thousand years.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_23.speaker: Player
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_23.text: Orpheus is a traitor? What did he do?

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_76.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_76.text: He sought Vlaakith's head in a ghaik ploy for her throne.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_69.speaker: Player
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_69.text: 'The Blood of the Mother'? Who is he, exactly?

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_28.speaker: Player
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_28.text: Orpheus? The very same who fought Vlaakith for the githyanki throne?

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_8.speaker: Player
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_8.text: A mighty powerful prince, if he can block out an illithid hivemind.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_45.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_45.text: And even more powerful still. It's said he could bring a thousand githyanki to their knees with one command.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_31.speaker: Player
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_31.text: What makes Orpheus such a threat to Vlaakith?

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_39.speaker: Player
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_39.text: Our dream figure is a mind flayer. Isn't that more concerning?

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_67.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_67.text: The illithid is a threat, make no mistake. But Orpheus is a greater one still.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_29.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_29.text: The Emperor, yes - a stunning revelation. But not so stunning as the prisoner.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_62.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_62.text: It is not the ghaik visitor that Vlaakith would destroy -
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_62.context: NodeContext: In a certain amount of awe.

WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_83.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_83.text: The Tainted Blood of the Mother. The traitor prince, the lakzerai.
WRD_AboutOrpheusAfterIntermezzo_83.context: NodeContext: In a certain amount of awe.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_40.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_40.text: It is done. My faith is acknowledged, my destiny set in slate.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_91.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_91.text: 'Vlaakith's mercy is as rare as the disciple who earns it.'

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_47.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_47.text: My queen, my eternal regent. Through your eternal wisdom, I will be legend!
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_47.context: NodeContext: Spoken with triumph. Said to the heavens as if Vlaakith were there

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_88.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_88.text: Do not let your pride lead to vanity. You must act for Vlaakith's glory, not your own.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_48.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_48.text: Wise words, kin - and so it must be. As Baht t'Vlaakith, I shall still be bound to all ten-thousand protocols.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_51.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_51.text: Lae'zel of K'liir, I honour your conviction. Vlaakith gha'g shkath zai!

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_92.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_92.text: Don't get ahead of yourself. Orpheus isn't dead yet.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_101.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_101.text: Chk. I have seen my future in the shimmering visage of my queen, heard it in her thundering voice.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_42.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_42.text: I'm proud of you. You've proved your loyalty at every step.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_13.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_13.text: You found your way back to Vlaakith. I'm proud of you.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_72.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_72.text: Let us bathe in our pride, then - but for just a moment. Pride turns to vanity if left too long fester.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_79.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_79.text: I shudder to think what would happen if you fail her now.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_36.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_36.text: Waste no time thinking about what won't come to pass.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_41.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_41.text: Orpheus will fall. And I will have my just rewards.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_30.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_30.text: Vlaakith gha'g shkath zai. Zai, zai, zai!
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_30.context:
NodeContext: VLAH-kith gawg shkaath ZAI!

Spoken with triumph.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_8.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_8.text: O! queen, you've heard my cries. Now, I heed your sacred mission.
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_8.context: NodeContext: Calling out to th eheavens

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_21.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_21.text: I will take the key from Voss' contact in the city. And I will free the prince so I might cleave him from brain to belly.
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_21.context: NodeContext: Calling out to the heavens

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_76.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_76.context:
NodeContext: cheh-MAR ZAL-ah VLAH-kith

Calling out to the heavens

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_39.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_39.text: I will hammer Orpheus free from his chains. And I will cleave him from brain to belly.
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_39.context: NodeContext: Calling out to the heavens

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_50.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_50.text: I will take the Orphic Hammer from Raphael's lair. The prince will be freed, so I might cleave him from brain to belly.
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_50.context: NodeContext: Calling out to the heavens

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_98.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_98.text: Voss waits at Sharess' Caress. I will retrieve the key that binds Orpheus - and then cleave him from brain to belly.
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_98.context: NodeContext: Calling out to the heavens

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_70.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_70.text: First, we find a way to free Orpheus from his astral chains. Then, we cleave him from brain to belly.
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_70.context: NodeContext: Calling out to the heavens

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_45.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_45.text: I have seen my future in the shimmering visage of my queen, heard it in her thundering voice.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_61.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_61.text: You turned my eyes to the truth. My faith is acknowledged, my destiny set in slate.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_93.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_93.text: You turned my eyes to the truth. Vlaakith's forsaken me - and there's no going back.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_96.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_96.text: As long as the Undying Queen reigns, I am never to soar unbound over the Astral Sea, never to cross the One in the Void.
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_96.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_6.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_6.text: As it should be. Better a short life built on truth than immortality woven of lies.
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_6.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_1.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_1.text: Better to unite the githyanki under a prince who would free their minds and honour their bodies.
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_1.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_11.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_11.text: So why do I feel so bitter?
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_11.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_100.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_100.text: You're grieving the future you'll never have. Vlaakith took everything from you.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_19.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_19.text: How well you've come to know me.
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_19.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, but gaining confidence.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_27.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_27.text: But in truth, she didn't take everything.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_7.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_7.text: I have what I have gathered for myself. I'm moored to a new regent, a new land, and new allies.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_75.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_75.text: I am known and honoured by you, the source of my bruises - and the source of my joy.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_26.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_26.text: I am known and honoured by you, the source of my bruises.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_37.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_37.text: Vlaakith cannot un-make she who no longer exists.
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_37.context: NodeContext: Fully confident, with particular pleased emphasis

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_89.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_89.text: Connect with Lae'zel's parasite and explore the furthest reaches of her emotions.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_62.speaker: Narrator
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_62.text: *Loss. It permeates every corner of Lae'zel's mind. Everything she knew to be true, every plan and aspiration she ever held, has been painfully ripped away.*

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_17.speaker: Narrator
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_17.text: *Lae'zel's bitterness is born of sadness. She is mourning the loss of the person she once was, and can never be again.*

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_22.speaker: Narrator
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_22.text: *Lae'zel has been ostracised by her queen. Why should she not feel bitter?*

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_49.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_49.text: Consider Lae'zel's past and present. What is the true source of her resentment?

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_99.speaker: Narrator
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_99.text: *Vlaakith has upended Lae'zel's whole existence. Everything she knew to be true, every plan and aspiration she ever held, has been painfully ripped away.*

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_86.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_86.text: Your own regent is terrorising you. You have good reason to hate her.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_54.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_54.text: I know hate. It seethes and distils into molten rock, forever rattling in the belly.
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_54.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_14.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_14.text: But I've never known this. I feel no heat, no cold; I bear neither fangs nor talon. There is only... absence.
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_14.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_43.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_43.text: No matter. I am Vlaakith's child no more. I have been born anew in Gith's son, my saviour.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_9.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_9.text: Ignore it, and keep faith in Orpheus. He'll give you everything you wanted.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_33.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_33.text: Yes. From doubt rises certainty: Orpheus, the Prince of the Comet. He is living truth, undeniable.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_90.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_90.text: I will have a home in Tu'narath yet, and Orpheus will be the light that guides me there.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_24.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_24.text: Because Voss told you the truth, and you slayed him for it.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_44.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_44.text: So I did. I have no excuse, and I deserve no forgiveness.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_73.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_73.text: But this, I pledge: to honour Voss through my dedication to our shared cause - Orpheus' freedom, and Vlaakith's destruction.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_38.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_38.text: I have been born anew in Gith's son, my saviour.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_34.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_34.text: And so from the old battle cries is birthed another:

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_83.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_83.text: Ch'mar, zal'a Orpheus. Mha stil'na forjun inyeri!
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_83.context:
NodeContext: Fully confident

cheh-MAR ZAL-a OR-fee-us. Mah STILL-na FOR-jun in-YARE-ee!

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_82.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_82.text: Orpheus' will above all. May the Comet blaze my path forward!

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_69.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_69.text: You've been quick to pledge yourself to Orpheus' cause. What about your own needs and wants?

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_58.speaker: Lae'zel
