WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_58.text: Orpheus' freedom is my want and my need. To deny his freedom would be to deny my own.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_5.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_5.text: There will come a time when I can think about myself beyond the lich queen who enslaves the githyanki and the prince who would liberate them.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_12.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_12.text: But that time won't come until the Prince of the Comet flies again.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_95.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_95.text: Vlaakith promised to make you Baht t'Vlaakith. An incredible honour.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_74.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_74.text: Vlaakith promised to make you Baht t'Vlaakith. Sounds impressive.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_77.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_77.text: Vlaakith's left hand, and her right - commander of all dragons, Chosen of the Queen Regent.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_32.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_32.text: Not since Vlaakith-One has a Baht t'Vlaakith been anointed.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_28.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_28.text: Another empty promise. Only a naive fool would believe otherwise. The kind of fool I was not so long ago.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_23.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_23.text: Once Orpheus is slain, I will take my place in Castle Susurrus as Baht t'Vlaakith the second.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_46.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_46.text: Every githyanki, and every red dragon, shall know me by the name.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_55.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_55.text: We find Voss' contact in Sharess' Caress. They alone hold the key to freeing the prince. Orpheus tavki na'zin!

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_2.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_2.text: We hammer Orpheus free from his chains at our first chance. Orpheus tavki na'zin!

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_84.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_84.text: Raphael knows how we can free Orpheus. We must see him at once. Orpheus tavki na'zin!

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_18.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_18.text: We take the Orphic Hammer from Raphael's lair. Orpheus tavki na'zin!

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_20.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_20.text: We find Voss at Sharess' Caress and retrieve the key to releasing the prince. Orpheus tavki na'zin!

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_78.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_78.text: We find Voss in the Sharess' Caress taproom. Orpheus tavki na'zin!

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_0.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_0.text: We find a way to free Orpheus from his astral chains. Orpheus tavki na'zin!

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_97.speaker: Player
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_97.text: I can't explain how you feel, Lae'zel.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_29.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_29.text: Chk. Then the feeling will fade like Vlaakith's craven projection.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_52.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_52.text: I am her child no more. I have been born anew in Gith's son, my saviour.

WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_94.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_94.text: It is done. There is no going back.
WRD_AfterVlaakithVisit_94.context: NodeContext: Slightly wistfully, slightly bitterly. Not too emotional, still generally confident, but tinged with the emotion of once and for all turning her back on Vlaakith.

WRD_SavedFromOrin_9.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_SavedFromOrin_9.text: It is not in a githyanki's nature to say 'thank you'.

WRD_SavedFromOrin_4.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_SavedFromOrin_4.text: Our language doesn't even have a phrase for it. 'Chraith'kan zharn' is the closest equivalent I know - 'May your enemies know agony'.

WRD_SavedFromOrin_7.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_SavedFromOrin_7.text: But after releasing me from Orin's grip, there is only one proper response:

WRD_SavedFromOrin_12.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_SavedFromOrin_12.text: Ah, hm. Well good then. Let's carry on.

WRD_SavedFromOrin_13.speaker: Player
WRD_SavedFromOrin_13.text: You are a powerful ally. I saved you with both our interests in mind.

WRD_SavedFromOrin_11.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_SavedFromOrin_11.text: You acted most rationally. So acknowledged.

WRD_SavedFromOrin_1.speaker: Player
WRD_SavedFromOrin_1.text: 'Thanks' barely covers it. You owe me a life debt.

WRD_SavedFromOrin_3.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_SavedFromOrin_3.text: You're breathing right now, are you not? I think you'll find I've paid that debt in advance.
WRD_SavedFromOrin_3.context: NodeContext: Not meanly, a bit cheekily

WRD_SavedFromOrin_0.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_SavedFromOrin_0.text: But I admire your dedication to provoking me on the rare occasion of my gratitude. Well done.
WRD_SavedFromOrin_0.context: NodeContext: Not meanly, a bit cheekily

WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_2.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_2.text: This Hammer - could it be? Yes, yes. This is how we will free the Prince of the Comet.

WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_21.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_21.text: This Hammer - this is the key. This is the means by which the traitor prince Orpheus can be freed -

WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_18.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_18.text: This Hammer - this is the key. This is the means by which the traitor prince Orpheus can be freed -

WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_10.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_10.text: - and we will make it the means of his killing.

WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_20.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_20.text: This Hammer - could it be? Yes, yes. This is how we will free the Prince of the Comet.

WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_1.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_1.text: This is the key Voss so ardently and courageously sought.

WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_19.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_19.text: That smug shka'keth of a devil stores it at his vaunted House of Hope. Our destination is clear, our mission undeniable:

WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_15.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_15.text: We must find a way into the House of Hope and retrieve the Hammer. When we next enter the Astral Prism, we will use it to smash Prince Orpheus out of his prison.

WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_12.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_12.text: Mother Gith, hear my promise: your son will rise again.
WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_12.context: NodeContext: Said as if in confident prayer.

WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_13.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_13.text: The Prince of the Comet will crush the lich queen Vlaakith, and usher in the Age of Orpheus.
WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_13.context: NodeContext: Said as if in confident prayer.

WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_5.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_5.text: We must find a way into the House of Hope and retrieve the hammer.

WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_8.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_8.text: When we next enter the Astral Prism, we will use it to smash Prince Orpheus out of his prison, and then tear his vile head from his body.

WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_0.speaker: Lae'zel
WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_0.text: Mighty Vlaakith, undying regent, hear my promise: the false prince will fall, and the Age of Vlaakith will be eternal.
WRD_LearnedAboutOrphicHammer_0.context: NodeContext: Said as if in confident prayer.
